medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms presented at age 10 months. Laboratory studies indicated hyperphosphatemia, mildly impaired renal function, and normal serum calcium, leading to slow remission of the periarticular lesions with treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homozygous mutation in FGF23 associated with hyperphosphatemic familial tumoral calcinosis (HFTC2).
medical_history.family_history: The mother is a heterozygous carrier of the mutation; the father's status is not specified.
